newsitem.title: USA: ALPINE SKIING-ITALY'S PANZANINI GRABS LEAD IN GIANT SLALOM.
newsitem.headline: ALPINE SKIING-ITALY'S PANZANINI GRABS LEAD IN GIANT SLALOM.

text.p: Italy's Sabina Panzanini, without a victory for more than two years, grabbed the lead after the first leg of a women's giant slalom on Thursday.

Panzanini, a 24-year-old in her fifth World Cup season, had a first-run time of 1:18.88, nearly half a second ahead of Austrian veteran Anita Wachter, timed in 1:19.36. Katja Seizinger of Germany, the defending overall champion who won the season's first race three weeks earler, was third in 1:19.72.
Still within striking distance, Hilde Gerg of Germany had 1:19.75 and Sonja Nef of Switzerland 1:19.84.

Early casualties included World Champion Deborah Compagnoni of Italy, who had the lead before skiing off the course halfway down. A similar fate befell Karin Roten of Switzerland, the World silver medalist. Mojca Sumadolc of Slovenia also failed to finish the first run.
